executive_summary: Highly computer-literate consumers from younger generations will begin participating in the mobile economy, further expanding the number of smartphone users. More frequent upgrades and a greater frequency of newly released devices with improved features will encourage new smartphone purchases. Growth in the number of smartphones and internet-enabled devices will boost industry revenue, though replacement demand and less rapid smartphone adoption will limit the need for more new cell phone repair establishments.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: External Industry Threats and Substitutes Begin to Mount
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: A major factor affecting demand for this industry will continue to be the decision to repair or replace equipment. The emergence of 5G wireless technology may encourage a more rapid transition to newer devices, discouraging customers from repairing damaged 3G or 4G devices.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Expected per capita disposable income growth
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Expected per capita disposable income growth and consumer sentiment will lead to more replacement purchases. As consumers have more money available to make discretionary purchases like cell phones, they will be less likely to try to stretch the useful lives of their cell phones by repairing them and instead spring for new devices.
Phones will become more durable and less apt to damage, which may hamper demand for cell phone repair services.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Highly computer-literate consumers from younger generations will begin participating in the mobile economy, further expanding the number of smartphone users.
More frequent upgrades and a greater frequency of newly released devices with improved features will encourage new smartphone purchases.

Growth in the number of smartphones and internet-enabled devices will boost industry revenue, though replacement demand and less rapid smartphone adoption will limit the need for more new cell phone repair establishments.

industry_definition: This industry primarily repairs and maintains cell phones. Some operators may repair tablets or other electronic devices as secondary services, which are also included in industry revenue. Industry operators include brick-and-mortar stores that enable customers to bring in their cell phones for immediate repair. Some stores also permit customers to mail in devices that need repairs.

negative_impact_factors: Low - Increasing Barriers To Entry Level

threats: Price of semiconductor and electronic components

key_trends: The growth in demand for smartphones has been a major driver of revenue
The rapid market acceptance of smartphones has created a need for more cell phone repair shops to keep up with this growing market
Rising incomes has allowed some consumers to buy new phones instead of repair them
Increasing smartphone use will continue to drive demand for repairs
Smartphone repair will continue to dominate industry services
As disposable income grows, consumers may increasingly replace their cell phones
Internet-enabled smartphones are more likely to be repaired than basic feature phones

market_segmentation.segment_description: Apple iPhone repairs dominate the market, representing 52% of industry revenue. New entrants should get Apple certification.
Samsung repairs make up 27% of revenue but require more training programs due to wide variety of devices.
Other brands like Motorola, HTC, LG have failed to find strong foothold as Apple and Samsung squeeze the market.

products_and_services.product_description: Most common repair due to cracked screens from impact. Accounts for 57.4% of services.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Button and Headphone Jack Repair and Replacement
products_and_services.product_description: Buttons and jacks get jammed or damaged from water. Make up 15.1% of services.
Batteries lose capacity over time and need replacement. Simple but can be costly. 11.3% of services.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Camera and Sensor Repair and Replacement
products_and_services.product_description: Cameras and sensors are sophisticated, repairs are technical. 7.5% of services.
Other repairs like cases, logic boards, software issues. Phones becoming more durable reduces frequency. 8.7% of services.

tier_1_suppliers: Communication Equipment Manufacturing in the US
Semiconductor & Circuit Manufacturing in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Wireless Telecommunications Carriers in the US
tier_1_buyers: Cell Phone Repair in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Most of the US population own cell phones and consider them necessities
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Most people will seek repair services or purchase a new phone in case of malfunction or minor damage. Economic conditions affect available income and repair vs replacement decisions.
Most new phones have 1-year warranty. Repairs often occur after warranty ends but before 2-year contract ends with carrier.
Complexity of new smartphones boosts repair demand due to high replacement cost. Self-repair is difficult, increasing demand for technicians.

international_trade_points.trade_description: Cell phone repair services are time-sensitive and performed domestically, mostly at the local level, limiting international trade.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast region accounts for the largest share of industry establishments at over 30% as well as the largest population share.
The Southwest region has around 20% of industry establishments.
The Mid-Atlantic region has around 15% of industry establishments while its population percentage is lower at around 10%.
The West region also has around 15% of establishments. California alone accounts for nearly 10% of industry establishments.
The Great Lakes region has a relatively lower percentage of both establishments and population compared to other regions.
The Plains region has a relatively lower percentage of both establishments and population compared to other regions.
The Rocky Mountains region has a relatively lower percentage of both establishments and population compared to other regions.
The New England region has a relatively lower percentage of both establishments and population compared to other regions.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The International Organization for Standardization has quality assurance requirements for organizations that produce, install and service products.
Phone manufacturers make their own rules that certified technicians must abide by due to patented technologies.

barriers_points.barrier_description: Companies like Apple and Samsung designate authorized repair shops, boosting reputation and reimbursement for warranty repairs.
Low start-up costs enable relatively easy market entry.

basis_points.basis_description: Companies compete based on repair service quality, convenience, location, timeliness, and price. Quality and reliability of repairs, warranties, and employing certified technicians are key factors.
Companies must price competitively to convince customers to repair rather than replace damaged phones with new devices.

concentration_points.concentration_description: The industry is highly fragmented with small localized enterprises dominating. Top 4 players account for less than 10% of revenue in 2023.
Industry concentration has remained stable as small independent companies generally own cell phone repair services.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Profit, defined as earnings before interest and taxes, is expected to average 5.7% of revenue in 2023.

In 2023, wages are expected to account for an estimated 44.7% of revenue. The Cell Phone Repair industry is highly labor-intensive, with no automated method for diagnosing problems and replacing defective parts.

In 2023, purchases are expected to make up the largest expense for companies, accounting for 7.2% of industry revenue. Cell phone repair businesses purchase replacement phone parts, including LCD screens, batteries, and other components.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: In 2023, the average shop spends $0.03 on capital expenditures for every $1.00 spent on labor, indicating a highly labor-intensive industry.
The tools spent on repairing cell phones are inexpensive and widely available.
As most of the repair work cost goes to the replacement of parts, the industry does not require a high level of machinery to conduct the repairs.

volatility_points.volatility_description: While repair services are sensitive to changes in business cycles and household income, much of the volatility in this industry is due to changes in technological trends.
The effects of the pandemic undermined industry revenue since 2020 as downstream demand declined broadly.
As the popularity of more expensive smartphones has increased, so has consumer demand for cell phone repairs rather than cell phone replacement.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Machinery and materials used in repair services make up all the technology in the Cell Phone Repairs industry.
While there is little technological change in repair equipment, the rate of change in cell phone manufacturer's parts is more rapid.
Mobile phone manufacturers regularly introduce new form factors, requiring repair technicians to purchase new replacement parts.

FAQs.question: Are your sales reliant on the overall health of the US economy (i.e. consumer spending and per capita disposable income)?
FAQs.answer: On one hand, a healthy economy will empower more people to fix broken phones. On the other hand, wealthier consumers may opt to purchase a new phone outright, forgoing repair shops altogether.

FAQs.question: What percent of revenue do you spend on advertising?
FAQs.answer: Given its highly fragmented nature, competition is generally based around price and location. A store located in lower Manhattan may do minimal advertising around its location, but would be wasting money advertising in upper Manhattan or any other borough.

FAQs.question: How does your company manage operating expenses to ensure maximum profitability?
FAQs.answer: The best way to decrease purchases costs is to buy replacement parts in bulk. However, most companies are not large enough to buy in bulk.

FAQs.question: What are your company's pricing strategies, especially in crowded markets?
FAQs.answer: This industry receives assistance from industry associations such as the National Electronics Service Dealers Association, which services professionals within the electronic repair industry. Its technical division, the International Society of Certified Electronics Technicians trains, tests and certifies technicians.

FAQs.question: Is your company investing in new technology to improve internal processes?
FAQs.answer: Timeliness is important in this industry as cell phones have become a part of life for many adults. As a result, internal processes that could increase efficiencies should always be considered.

FAQs.question: Does your company leverage social media platforms, such as Facebook, Twitter and Yelp, to establish a stronger market presence?
FAQs.answer: Using Yelp and other review sites is extremely important for industry companies as reputation is a factor that consumers consider before bringing their cell phones in. Companies can encourage past customers to rate their experience online, will may help promote more business.

FAQs.question: Is your company subject to any franchising laws?
FAQs.answer: The largest industry company, Cell Phone Repair Franchise Systems, operates as a franchisor. This company has hundreds of franchises across the country. Those looking to open a franchise should contact the franchisor for any state or local franchise laws.

FAQs.question: How does your company stay ahead of regulations, such as energy-efficiency standards?
FAQs.answer: Companies in this industry are not subject to health or environmental regulatory standards, as these companies simply purchase parts from manufacturers and repair devices.

FAQs.question: How does your company's profit margins compare to your main competitors?
FAQs.answer: Most companies will record profit margins near the industry average. There are few value-added services that companies can offer which would increase revenue and profit.

FAQs.question: What ongoing financing challenges does your company face?
FAQs.answer: Barriers to entry are low. After launch, the barriers to stay operational drop even further. The most significant expense for the industry is purchase costs, which is directly related to the demand. If demand is low, companies should slow the amount of parts they buy from suppliers.

FAQs.question: Is your company dominant in any particular regional markets? How can you expand your geographic reach?
FAQs.answer: Consumers requiring cell phone repair will likely use services that operate locally in order to save time and shipping costs.

FAQs.question: Do your potential hires need to have past knowledge of the product? What ongoing training do you provide for your employees?
FAQs.answer: Due to the fast-changing technological nature of the industry, technicians must have a strong technical expertise in cell phones.

FAQs.question: Do you specialize in certain services? How do you change your services to keep up with new technology?
FAQs.answer: A wide range of cell phone repair services that will address the majority of customers' repair needs will help generate additional revenue.

FAQs.question: How can you mitigate the effects of consumers purchasing new phones rather than fixing their broken phones? How do you advertise your services?
FAQs.answer: Higher disposable incomes may encourage wealthier consumers to purchase new devices rather than replace damaged older devices.

FAQs.question: How does online retail affect your business model? What benefits do you provide as opposed to online operators?
FAQs.answer: The percentage of services conducted online reflects demand for wireless internet access.

FAQs.question: How closely do you monitor internet use? What percentage of your business comes from smartphone users?
FAQs.answer: Growing demand for mobile internet access drives demand for cell phone repairs, as internet-enabled smartphones are more expensive than basic-feature phones and are therefore more likely to be repaired instead of replaced.
